tool_description: High-performance continuous screen monitoring using OpenCV with configurable FPS and real-time analysis

available_commands.description: Get current monitoring status, FPS, and capture statistics
Force immediate capture and analysis outside regular interval

tool_usage_guidance: Automatic continuous monitoring - captures screen at target FPS
Analyzes frames at configurable intervals (default 5 seconds)
Screen descriptions automatically injected into thought buffer with HIGH priority
Change detection prevents redundant analysis of static screens
Non-blocking threaded capture - AI continues thinking while capturing
10-20x faster than PyAutoGUI (10-50ms vs 200ms per capture)
Perfect for VTuber streaming and real-time game awareness
Use get_status to monitor performance and statistics
Use capture_now to force immediate analysis for important moments
Adjust FPS based on CPU load (lower = less overhead)
Adjust interval based on how frequently you need updates
proactive_triggers: Triggers on significant screen changes (configurable threshold)
Perfect for gaming, streaming, and interactive scenarios

notes: Requires Ollama running with vision model (llava:latest or similar)
Uses MSS for native OS screen capture (much faster than PyAutoGUI)
Non-blocking architecture - capture runs in background thread
Thought buffer integration via context_loop (BaseTool architecture)
Change detection reduces unnecessary API calls
Suitable for real-time VTuber and gaming applications
Can coexist with other vision tools (vision, game_vision)
